main event: A witness observed what appeared to be a shooting star burning out, emitting orange light and sparks, in Middle Village, N.Y. on October 10, 1961.
interesting points: The object moved very fast and did not explode before burning out., The object emitted a blue-green line of light that illuminated the ground., The sighting lasted for approximately 1 minute., The witness estimated the distance to be around four to five miles at one point., The report indicated no connection to UFO-related activities.
sighted object: a shooting star or object burning out
witness description: Witness was in Briarcliff Manor, approximately 27 miles from the sighting location.
